verses.verse: (Num 12.6; 2 Kings 15.1, 13, 32; 16.1; 18.1; Isa 2.1) The vision of Isaiah son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
(The Wickedness of Judah) (Deut 32.1) Hear, O heavens, and listen, O earth, for the LORD has spoken: I reared children and brought them up, but they have rebelled against me.
(Jer 8.7; 9.3, 6) The ox knows its owner and the donkey its master’s crib, but Israel does not know; my people do not understand.

(v 28|ISA 1:28; Isa 5.24; 14.20) Woe, sinful nation, people laden with iniquity, offspring who do evil, children who act corruptly, who have forsaken the LORD, who have despised the Holy One of Israel, [[who are utterly estranged!]] (Gk OL lack: Heb adds who are utterly estranged)
(Isa 31.6; 33.24) Why do you seek further beatings? Why do you continue to rebel? The whole head is injured, and the whole heart faint.

(Job 2.7; Ps 38.3; Isa 30.26; Lk 10.34) From the sole of the foot to the head, there is no soundness in it, only bruises and sores and bleeding wounds; they have not been drained or bound up or softened with oil.
(Isa 6.11; Jer 44.6) Your country lies desolate; your cities are burned with fire; in your very presence aliens devour your land; it is desolate, as overthrown by foreigners.
And daughter Zion is left like a booth in a vineyard, like a shelter in a cucumber field, like a besieged city.
(Isa 10.20-22; Rom 9.29) If the LORD of hosts had not left us a few survivors, we would have been like Sodom and become like Gomorrah.
(Isa 3.9; 28.14; Ezek 16.46; Rev 11.8) Hear the word of the LORD, you rulers of Sodom! Listen to the teaching of our God, you people of Gomorrah!

(1 Sam 15.22; Jer 6.20; Mic 6.7) What to me is the multitude of your sacrifices? says the LORD; I have had enough of burnt offerings of rams and the fat of fed beasts; I do not delight in the blood of bulls or of lambs or of goats.
(Ex 23.17) When you come to appear before me, (Or see my face) who asked this from your hand? Trample my courts no more!

(Ex 12.16; 1 Chr 23.31; Isa 66.3; Jer 7.9, 10) Bringing offerings is futile; incense is an abomination to me. New moon and Sabbath and calling of convocation— I cannot endure solemn assemblies with iniquity.
(Lev 23.2; Num 28.11; Isa 7.13; 43.24) Your new moons and your appointed festivals my soul hates; they have become a burden to me; I am weary of bearing them.
(1 Kings 8.22; Isa 8.17; 59.2, 3; Mic 3.4) When you stretch out your hands, I will hide my eyes from you; even though you make many prayers, I will not listen; your hands are full of blood.
(Isa 52.11; 55.7; Jer 4.14; 25.5) Wash yourselves; make yourselves clean; remove your evil deeds from before my eyes; cease to do evil;
(Ps 82.3; Isa 58.6; Jer 22.3) learn to do good; seek justice; rescue the oppressed; defend the orphan; plead for the widow.
(Ps 51.7; Isa 43.26; Rev 7.14) Come now, let us argue it out, says the LORD: If your sins are like scarlet, will they become like snow? If they are red like crimson, will they become like wool?
(Deut 30.15, 16) If you are willing and obedient, you shall eat the good of the land,
(Isa 3.25; 34.16) but if you refuse and rebel, you shall be devoured by the sword, for the mouth of the LORD has spoken.
(The Degenerate City) (Isa 59.7; Jer 2.20) How the faithful city has become a prostitute! She that was full of justice, righteousness lodged in her— but now murderers!
(Ezek 22.18) Your silver has become dross; your wine is mixed with water.

(Ex 23.8; Jer 5.28; Hos 9.15; Mic 7.3; Zech 7.10) Your princes are rebels and companions of thieves. Everyone loves a bribe and runs after gifts. They do not defend the orphan, and the widow’s cause does not come before them.
(Isa 35.4; 49.26) Therefore says the Sovereign, the LORD of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel: Surely I will pour out my wrath on my enemies and avenge myself on my foes!
(Mal 3.3) I will turn my hand against you; I will smelt away your dross as with lye and remove all your alloy.
(Jer 33.7; Zech 8.3) And I will restore your judges as at the first and your counselors as at the beginning. Afterward you shall be called the city of righteousness, the faithful city.
Zion shall be redeemed by justice, and those in her who repent, by righteousness.
(Ps 9.5; Isa 24.20; 2 Thess 1.8, 9) But rebels and sinners shall be destroyed together, and those who forsake the LORD shall be consumed.
(Isa 57.5; 65.3) For you shall be ashamed of the oaks in which you delighted, and you shall blush for the gardens that you have chosen.
For you shall be like an oak whose leaf withers and like a garden without water.
(Isa 5.24; 66.24; Mt 3.12) The strong shall become like tinder and their work like a spark; they and their work shall burn together, with no one to quench them.
